messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Boy Scouts of America Legal cases
messages.msgSnippet: Well, consider the source.  The ACLU is also fighting tooth and nail for NAMBLA! Lynda ... From: Vicki A. Dennis  To:
messages.messageBody:
Well, consider the source. The ACLU is also fighting tooth and nail for
NAMBLA!

Lynda

----------
From: Vicki A. Dennis <mamaxaos@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Boy Scouts of America Legal cases
Date: Thursday, September 28, 2000 9:56 PM

Food for thought regarding both the nature of Boy Scouts and whether there
is any public funding.

http://www.religioustolerance.org/bsa_1.htm

Some excerpts:

Federal laws have been passed to allow the military to provide
transportation for Scouts and to loan them equipment without charge. Every
national Boy Scout jamboree since 1981 has been held on a military base.


Many local councils receive substantial funding from the United Way. Such
United Ways have a national and local policy of not ordinarily funding any
charitable organization which discriminates on a basis of a religious test
or a sexual orientation test. Many United Ways have stopped funding the Boy
Scouts. However, many still continue such funding.

San Diego CA: The American Civil Liberties Union and the Tom Homann Law
Association have asked the city of San Diego to end its financial subsidies
to the Boy Scouts until the BSA ends its discrimination based on sexual
orientation and religion. The legal groups are also asking that the city
council end its $1.00 lease to the Boy Scouts council for their
headquarters office in Balboa Park. An end to the rent-free use of
city-owned property on Fiesta Island is also sought.

messages.msgSnippet: Food for thought regarding both the nature of Boy Scouts and whether  there is any public funding. http://www.religioustolerance.org/bsa_1.htm Some excerpts:
messages.messageBody:
Food for thought regarding both the nature of Boy Scouts and whether  there is any public funding.

 http://www.religioustolerance.org/bsa_1.htm
 
Some excerpts:
 
Federal laws have been passed to allow the military to provide transportation for Scouts and to loan them equipment without charge. Every national Boy Scout jamboree since 1981 has been held on a military base.
 
Many local councils receive substantial funding from the United Way. Such United Ways have a national and local policy of not ordinarily funding any charitable organization which discriminates on a basis of a religious test or a sexual orientation test. Many United Ways have stopped funding the Boy Scouts.  However, many still continue such funding.
 
San Diego CA: The American Civil Liberties Union and the Tom Homann Law Association have asked the city of San Diego to end its financial subsidies to the Boy Scouts until the BSA ends its discrimination based on sexual orientation and religion. The legal groups are also asking that the city council end its $1.00 lease to the Boy Scouts council for their  headquarters office in Balboa Park. An end to the rent-free use of city-owned property on Fiesta Island is also sought.
